statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 4 \\ 5 \\ 1 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 0 \\ -1 \\ 2 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 8 \\ 10 \\ 2 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 21 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ -13 \\ -9 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -1 \\ 4 \\ -4 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 4 \\ 5 \\ 1 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 0 \\ -1 \\ 2 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 8 \\ 10 \\ 2 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 21 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ -13 \\ -9 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -1 \\ 4 \\ -4 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
